comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Mrs WJ Gaynor , at this stage the widow of the mayor of New York City who had died in September 1913, was the former Augusta Cole Mayer. see books.google.com/books?id=WN90SSAJ4JMC&pg=PA28&lp... A society register of 1912 indicates names for three of their eight children: Helen, Norman, and Rufus. So I think that the Bain attempts at identification have been mis-interpreted in the cataloging. According to NYT of Jan 25, 1921 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F04EFD7153CE533A... Ruth Merritt Gaynor was their youngest daughter

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The Bain photo, dated April 21, celebrates a happy event that took place on April 16, 1914 -- the wedding of the late mayor's son, Norman J. Gaynor, to Betsy Page. The ceremony took place in Fairfax Court House, Virginia. The photo of the wedding attendees (likely posed at the railroad station in New York City) may have been taken upon their return. New York Times story, April 17, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F50915F93D5E13...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Norman J. Gaynor, the shy bridegroom, in two Bain/LOC photos dated March 7, 1914, when his forthcoming nuptials were announced:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4998196069/]
